task_summary: Detect the T-shaped block and the target marker, align the circular end-effector, push the block toward the target along ~45°, verify arrival, then retreat.

task_long_description.overview: A fixed-base manipulator with a circular blue end-effector must push a T-shaped block across a white tabletop to a marked target. Visual confirmation of both the block and target is required before contact. The robot approaches from above, aligns its yaw for a directed push, performs a single deliberate push stroke, then verifies that the block reached the target area. Movements should be precise and time-bounded; perception can be retried. Finally, the arm retreats to clear the workspace.
preconditions: Workspace is clear except for the T-shaped block and a visible target marker
Camera provides views enabling DetectObject for both block and target
Controller and perception run nominally at ~10 Hz
stepwise_plan: Move above the block and approach to gentle contact with alignment
Set yaw to align push toward the target (~45°)
Execute a push with bounded distance
Verify block proximity to target marker
success_criteria: Block ends within the target marker neighborhood
No collisions with fixtures or leaving the workspace
failure_and_recovery: Perception failure: retry detection up to 3 times
Misalignment: approach-and-align step ensures tolerance before pushing
Push short/overshoot: verification will fail; sequence ends for external retry
task_long_description.termination: Tree succeeds when IsAt(target_marker) is true after the push; otherwise it fails. In both cases, the arm performs a short retreat and wait.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

task_instruction: The task requires pushing a T-shaped block (gray) to a fixed target (green) with a circular end-effector (blue). Both observation and control frequencies are 10Hz.

node_specs.description: Vision detection of the T-shaped block with retry.
Vision detection of the target circle with retry.
Move above block with safe clearance.
Close in and align end-effector to the block before pushing.
Orient tool yaw toward push direction.
Verify tool yaw is at 45 degrees.
Single push stroke toward the target.

failure_modes: Block or target not detected due to lighting/occlusion
Contact causes block rotation away from intended direction
recovery_strategy: Re-approach and align before pushing to meet tolerance
If verification fails, tree ends; operator/system can relaunch full sequence
assumptions: Frames show a red T-block and a bluish target marker; instruction mentions gray block and green target—frames were preferred.
Target direction estimated ~45° (toward upper-right) from contact sheet; encoded in yaw and push direction.
No grasping is required; pure pushing interaction assumed.

expected_success_criteria: IsAt(target_marker) returns true after the push; no collisions; retreat executed
